history.content:
I usually just take a class that looks interesting.

Astro C10/C12 are good options if you're interested in astronomy, and I've also taken Integrative Bio 11 (California Natural History, we just go on hikes and overnight field trips). I sometimes take a Berkeley connect course to meet new people in a different subject area. Nutri Sci 10 and Physed 32 are good choices if you're interested in improving your physical health. If you're interested in learning about your ethnic background, you can take a history course about the region you're from (I'm thinking about taking a middle eastern history course) or a language course. There's also a few random interesting courses I saw in the catalog about how ancient cultures viewed magic. There's drawing/painting/ceramics classes as well that are pretty fun.

These are just some of my recommendations, but normally I just look through the catalog for something that looks interesting. If you have extra space on your schedule, it's up to you how you want to shape your education and what you want to get out of being at Berkeley.

I'm currently a sophomore who finished their breadths and only have CS techs left to take. I think I probably would only need to take 2 elective courses and even if I double major in DS or Applied Math I'd still be able to get by taking 2, rarely 3 techs a semester. What do CS majors in LS usually do to make the 13 unit mark if only taking 2 techs a semester?
history.subject: What non-tech classes do CS majors do get to 13 units?
